line_1: To him that Wealth, by Traffick, wou'd procure.
line_2: A settl'd Quiet, and Conveyance sure,

line_1: Are charms which no art can procure;
line_2: And your empire is solid and sure.

line_1: For me one blissful draught procure.
line_2: From forth thy sacred well-fount pure

line_1: Then if I can a pilot wise procure,
line_2: Lets in the water, and I must recure

line_1: Then if I can a pilot wise procure,
line_2: And moor'd in harbour she shall ride secure;

line_1: Then if I can a pilot wise procure,
Menon, he said, my wishes to procure,
line_2: I'll give thee cities, and a boundless store

line_1: When ropes or opium can my ease procure?
line_2: Shame, pain, or poverty shall I endure,

line_1: Could I the privilege of peer procure,
line_2: The rich I'd bully, and oppress the poor.

line_1: Blest age! when all men may procure
And from all People due respect procure,
line_2: Her virtue did her Husbands love insure,

line_1: And from all People due respect procure,
line_2: Only her Rival cou'd not her endure.

line_1: Our joy from sorrow to procure,
line_2: And rise from ardent trials pure.
